ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] L30, now what?
ygData.msgSnippet: Re: The Harvester, at lvl 32, my ranger was able to easily solo him, so for my necro, it prolly could ve been done at 29 or so.  The mutant eye fungus thing
ygData.messageBody:
Re: The Harvester, at lvl 32, my ranger was able to easily solo him, so for
my necro, it prolly could've been done at 29 or so. The mutant eye fungus
thing was also pretty easily attainable for my ranger, especially since I
was being escorted by a lvl50 druid. As far as the shadowed scythe, I just
happened upon a group that was camping them and they were kind enough to
allow me that 1 particular loot.

As to where to find the goblin headmaster, I stumbled upon his island after
a cyc camping session. If I remember correctly, the island isn't too far
from the sister isle, it's easily recognized as it's 1 of the few goblin
islands in OOT.

Z

----- Original Message -----
From: Mark Rafn <dagon@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 2:29 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] L30, now what?


> Made L30 this weekend, have a few questions:
>
> 1) any hints on the SolRo quests beyond what's on Allakhazam's
> (http://everquest.allakhazam.com/quests/Q_Temple_Solusek.htm)?
>
> For the Harvester, I need a shadowed knife, which is from a goblin in OOT
> rather than a shadowed man. Where in OOT can I find the goblin
> headmaster? Is he soloable at 30?
>
> Any thoughts on shadow men? Do all the items drop randomly off all the
> shadow men, or are there better places than others to find the shadowed
> scythe and eye/hand/mask of shadow. Are there any camps that are
> soloable or takable by a pair/trio, or will I need a full group?
>
> 2) where's good hunting (and good groups) at L30? Sarnaks, goblins, and
> forest giants in Warsliks and Lake of Ill Omen have been great from 20-29,
> and it was always easy to find or start a decent group. Now those spots
> are starting to green out.
>
> I came back to the old world at 30 to try some of my old haunts, but both
> cazic-thule and unrest have been very disappointing. The unrest basement
> wasn't bad except for the powerlevellers (2 different L50+ druids
> levelling L20-L25 people) pulling past us and causing havoc. Cazic would
> be nice, except the three groups I found all had at least one complete
> idiot in them, and we spent more time zoning/dieing than fighting.
>
> Any advice appreciated. I don't like soloing very much (too much
> downtime, not enough interaction, and no chance to use our best abilities
> like shadow compact and screaming terror), but I'll consider it since
> downtime in a bad group is worse than soloing.
> --
> Mark Rafn dagon@... <http://www.dagon.net/>
>
>
